item.title: By: Joseph Scott

item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/02/21/google-glass/#comment-3989">John Hawkins</a>.
The potential for awkward situations is unlimited, sounds like the perfect topic for a Glass spoof video :-)

In reply to John Hawkins.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/02/21/google-glass/#comment-3988">Alex Mills</a>.
In combination with phones/tables/computers there is lots of cool possibilities. If everything Glass did also synced back to those devices then roaming around with just Glass sometimes would work nicely as well.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Alex Mills.

In combination with phones/tables/computers there is lots of cool possibilities. If everything Glass did also synced back to those devices then roaming around with just Glass sometimes would work nicely as well.

item.title: By: John Hawkins
item.dc:creator: John Hawkins
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/02/21/google-glass/#comment-3988">Alex Mills</a>.
Exactly! Because you can't always say "Glasses, take a picture of the creepy guy sitting in front of me"
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Alex Mills.

Exactly! Because you can’t always say “Glasses, take a picture of the creepy guy sitting in front of me”

item.title: By: Alex Mills
item.dc:creator: Alex Mills
item.description: Yeah, looks awesome but there's something to be said for non-voice input. Who wants to be constantly talking to themselves while waiting for the bus with people nearby hearing your conversation? It'd be cool to use your phone as a keyboard for it.
item.content:encoded: Yeah, looks awesome but there’s something to be said for non-voice input. Who wants to be constantly talking to themselves while waiting for the bus with people nearby hearing your conversation? It’d be cool to use your phone as a keyboard for it.
